name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed to SCOTUS. 

From the moment RBG died, Republicans knew they would fight for this moment, now just 8 days before an election Ted Cruz called a potential "bloodbath."

My story on why Republicans did it, and at what cost:
https://t.co/itnCirA3Dj

name: TheAtlantic
text: NASA’s big moon announcement is here, and don’t worry—the moon is fine, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/Ia8NoqHrsc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Countrypolitan places "are distinct from rural areas, which are mostly Republican, and cities, which are heavily Democratic ... That makes them pivotal counties, in 2020 and in the future," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/hA5d42h9am

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’d swear that some nights a hardheaded Sean Hannity answers five doors or phone calls in a row. But on the best days, the discussions are transformative," @GeorgeGoehl writes: https://t.co/dTwzysiEJ2

name: TheAtlantic
text: The rushed appointment of Amy Coney Barrett to the Supreme Court tells a story of a party aware of its own weaknesses. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/joPJUjaDvR

name: TheAtlantic
text: "While I won’t let anything distract me from doing my job as governor, I will not stand back and let the president, or anyone else, put my colleagues and fellow Americans in danger without holding him accountable," @GovWhitmer writes: https://t.co/mcyWYtjeN5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Republicans understand that Barrett’s confirmation is coming just a week before a potential electoral “bloodbath.” They don’t care, @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/rrgO5Ej3GP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: With a week to go before the US election, @helenlewis hits on something all us foreigners know to be true, but can never quite articulate: The Internet Speaks American https://t.co/PWt7nqmaji

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @helenlewis: Wrote about how sharing the internet with America is like sharing your living room with a rhinoceros.  It’s huge, it’s right there, and whatever it’s doing now, you sure as hell know about it.

https://t.co/M73VrOFKAv

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: "Every time the president ramps up this violent rhetoric, every time he fires up Twitter to launch another broadside against me, my family and I see a surge of vicious attacks sent our way.” https://t.co/VKZvryu3Dp

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: "He is sowing division and putting leaders, especially women leaders, at risk. And all because he thinks it will help his reelection." @GovWhitmer writes: https://t.co/IArlbD3MlH

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Supreme Court is helping Republicans rig elections, @AdamSerwer wrote last week. The Democratic Party has "only one option if it wishes to defend the most fundamental rights of its constituents and the vitality of American democracy: Pack the Court." https://t.co/0u56jNlGvt

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sharing the internet with America is like sharing your living room with a rhinoceros, says @helenlewis. It’s huge, it’s right there, and whatever it’s doing now, you sure as hell know about it. https://t.co/EDGrMLYfWy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The federal government and the states should go ahead and soak the rich to reduce inequality and raise money for health care, child care, infrastructure investment, education, decarbonization, and a thousand other priorities," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/xkh86XzGIb

name: TheAtlantic
text: 1/ The decisions of President Trump and his administration have transformed countless lives.  We are telling the stories of seven individuals living with the consequences of his first term. https://t.co/GOdZoXx0WA

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2/ After the Trump administration allowed states to attach work requirements to Medicaid, one grad student lost her coverage. Without prescriptions to manage her ADHD and asthma, she turned to cocaine and painkillers for relief, @MonicaBPotts reports. https://t.co/bMsaC9MPxY

name: TheAtlantic
text: 3/ Barbara Szalai wasn't worried about moving upriver from a coal plant. Decades later, she says, “If I had my way, I would have left.” @prosaaquino reports: https://t.co/lX90rPtTMR

name: TheAtlantic
text: 4/ Natalie Romero was badly hurt in Charlottesville when a neo-Nazi plowed his car into a crowd. Years later, she's still feeling the aftershocks, @marincogan reports. https://t.co/lR0pxaaMNg

name: TheAtlantic
text:
5/ After Justin Walker gave 119 media interviews to support Brett Kavanaugh, the president offered Walker a lifetime appointment to one of the nation’s highest courts, @cristianafarias reports.
https://t.co/lc76dmK3gs

name: TheAtlantic
text: 6/ “It’s not easy not having your children with you ... I wouldn’t have left them in the first place.” One mother planned to bring her kids to the U.S. after her. Then the Trump administration banned immigration from Nigeria. @koviebiakolo reports:https://t.co/AUuHf6kv5e

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even when wealthy people encounter misfortune on-screen, they’re suffering on yachts." Hannah Giorgis on HBO's "The Undoing" and the tricky allure of shows about ultrarich people who do bad things: https://t.co/S5w90v7DgR

name: TheAtlantic
text:
In The Weekly Planet, @yayitsrob explores the special political power of coal. Also, why the Hummer EV is an enormous, chrome-plated olive branch. Read it here: https://t.co/yesI3KMSup 
And sign up to get every issue in your inbox here: https://t.co/Jv9sjdhF7A

name: TheAtlantic
text: The top-scoring panoramic photos entered in the eleventh Epson International Pano Awards have just been announced. A selection of photos, via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/4Qn9KSeHpG https://t.co/eICOT1wfro

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: "We treat democracy like clean water, something that just comes out of the tap, something we exert no effort to procure." https://t.co/HGxkLIb2Op via @anneapplebaum

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "What happens when another country’s conversation about race takes place in an 'American accent'?" https://t.co/PWt7nq4yUI

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Winners of the 2020 Epson International Pano Awards - 23 of the winning and honored images submitted to the 11th annual panoramic photo competition. https://t.co/ROzsfWdkYh https://t.co/Ele091tW4T

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "Undisputed rule over the English-language internet ... isn’t good for the United States. Being part of the dominant group always leads to shortsightedness: an assumption that your laws, culture, and taboos are universal, the default state of humanity." https://t.co/PWt7nqmaji

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @marincogan: Today @TheAtlantic is publishing a series of articles I commissioned and edited over the last several months.

The Trump administration has impacted countless lives. Here are the stories of seven people living with the consequences of his first term. https://t.co/MULyL5bG48
